sponsors.name: Jeonju University
sponsors.description: Jeonju University is a private university located on the west end of Jeonju. It has been host to the Jeonju-North Jeolla KOTESOL chapters workshops and Conferences since 2014.

sponsors.name: KOTESOL
sponsors.description: KOTESOL is a non-profit, professional organization that seeks to assist teachers in self-development and improve English Language Teaching in Korea.

sponsors.name: TOP English Bookstore
sponsors.description: One of the oldest, largest, and best known English bookstores in Jeonju. Located near Gaeksa.

sponsors.name: Tacocino
sponsors.description: A Mexican taco restaurant located in Shinsikaji near Jeonju University. Specializes in tacos, quesadillas, burritos, and fajitas.

sponsors.name: Lemon Tree Cafe
sponsors.description: A Korean coffee shop located down on the road between Gaeksa and Hanok Village.

sponsors.name: Cambridge University Press
sponsors.description: Cambridge University Press dates from 1534 and is part of the University of Cambridge. Our mission is to unlock people's potential with the best learning and research solutions.

sponsors.name: The Liter Coffee
sponsors.description: A cheaper, more affordable coffee, up to 1 liter in capacity.

sponsors.name: Yega Restaurant
sponsors.description: A traditional style Korean restaurant located at the base of Moak Mountain and specializing in healthy Korean food, particularly Chungkukjang.

sponsors.name: English Garden
sponsors.description: A unique Patchwork Studio with bright interior decor, artwork, old Korean sewing machines, and a large collection of (even English) books.

sponsors.name: March Rabbit
sponsors.description: A salad can even qualify as a filling meal.

sponsors.name: Solasta Yoga
sponsors.description: A non-profit yoga club in Jeonju, South Korea offering yoga asana, pranayama, meditation and a compassionate community in a supportive and beautiful space.
